name: Pipe2py
body:
### Introduction
The pipe2py package can compile a Yahoo! Pipe into pure Python source code, or it can interpret the pipe on-the-fly. It supports embedded pipes too.

![Yahoo! Pipes Editor](http://www.wordloosed.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/pipe.png)

```
$ python compile.py -p UuvYtuMe3hGDsmRgPm7D0g

$ python pipe_UuvYtuMe3hGDsmRgPm7D0g.py

Name (default=Lancaster) Osborne
{u'firstName': u'Mr George',
...
u'TotalAllowancesClaimedIncTravel': u'151015'}
```

### Google App Engine
[pipes-engine](http://pipes-engine.appspot.com/) uses pipe2py to run your Yahoo! Pipes on Googleâ€™s servers. It retrieves and stores Yahoo! Pipes definitions, compiles them to Python and then runs them when requested on Google's App Engine.
tagline: A project to compile Yahoo! Pipes into Python
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
